title: Fantastic experience in A and E
body:
My husband had an accident at a holiday home we had just arrived at in Ludlow after a 3 hour journey down from Liverpool. He ran into a glass door and pushed his tooth through the vermillion border of his upper lip splitting it straight through, rather unpleasant. I called Kidderminster minor injuries explained the injury and the said they could only send us to Worcester A and E which was a 50 minute drive away. 

From the moment we arrived at A and E we had an exemplary experience. The check in admin team were efficient. We only waited 10 minutes for the triage nurse, she was marvellous, very thorough and reassuring. Max-Fax was bleeped and they came to the rescue. They were confident, knowledgeable and a delight from start to finish. The work was extremely neat and they sorted us out in no time. 

I am a dentist and work in the NHS myself. I know the enormous pressure they are under at present and want to say a massive thank you and well done to your A and E team. I can’t sing your praises enough. You’re a credit to the profession!!

title: Exemplary care
body:
I had to rush my adult HF Autistic, mentally ill, Type one diabetic child to the E.D due to sickness & diahorrea. Bloods were high with extreme ketones, DKA had set in.
Having explained to a Nurse what was happening as we stood in the queue in the E.D, my child was taken through to a cubicle as I booked them in. We were, for want of expression "fast tracked" into the actual E.D. found a bed, medical attention began immediately.
From there on in, medical care was exemplary. All staff sharing what was happening, why & what would happen next.
Staff, Nurses, Doctors, HCA's, Porters, even volunteers making drinks, fetching blankets were out of this world. Nothing was too much trouble, as was the same as my child was transferred to AMU, then eventually onto the diabetic ward, ward 513.
Staff were approachable, caring, considerate & thoroughly professional.
Thank you ALL for your fast actions, saving my child from further serious illness.
Where would we be without our amazing QEHB & our NHS?
Sincere thanks again to you ALL.
Thank you often isn't enough.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Uncompassionate Care
body: I Was referred by my surgery to see a GP on this surgery because apparently they are now part of a ‘hub’. Well, this is extremely dangerous as the GP that I saw today do not have the ‘basic’ quality of a healthcare professional trait. Being able to listen, communicate without aggression and compassionate towards the patients and the his job in general. He even made a diagnosis of my condition without even physically examining me and I told him that I am not surprised as still to this point of time a lot of patients died of cancer because the GP that should be the first contact failed the patients. I wouldn’t even dare recommend this surgery to anyone.

title: Deep vein thrombosis
body:
My GP sent me for a scan as he thought I had a deep vein thrombosis,
The treatment ,was excellent, the scan showed it was a DVT.I was then taken by this Dr that did the scan, to see a Dr, at theACA department.
The treatment I received there was excellent,The Dr I saw ,was first class ,he
Explained everything .what was going to happen.He had a good patient manner, and put you at ease, with his good sense of humour.I was asked to come back the next day .to see him, and it he was that cheerful  same Dr.
When I asked him how many hours he had been working,I did think how could he still be so cheerful. I have nothing but praise for the treatment I received from that dedicated Dr,I give him 11 out of 10.I wish I was able to name him as he deserves to be named.

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Amazing Birth Centre Midwives
body:
I gave birth at the birth centre of Queen Charlotte and Chelsea and I couldn’t expect anything better. The midwives which supported me throughout,  prenatally and during Labour and postnatally including breastfeeding was 
outstanding. The midwives which worked to deliver my baby were extremely experienced, knew what they were doing and cared to the utmost level to ensure I had the best experience. I was able to deliver without using any painkillers to my surprise, as they supported me so much. They also were so helpful in establishing breastfeeding before I left hospital.

title: Conscientious Service
body: Needed laser surgery for Posterior capsular opacification After a long wait on a Saturday which I very much appreciate staff giving up their weekends this was performed successfully My eye site in one  eye was very poor and after cataract surgery on the other eye it then became blurred due to this condition and I had difficulty in doing many ordinary things including driving. I text my daughter after the procedure saying ‘ I feel that I am now seeing the world in a different light’ Many thanks to all the staff involved from diagnosis to treatment I may have had a long wait but it was well worth it

readBy.name: University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust

title: Terrible practice
body: I had a hysteroscopy. It was painful, traumatic,the information I was given beforehand downplayed the procedure. I've no understanding why pain relief wasn't given. I went into what I can only describe as shock. When researched this is a common mistreatment happening, something needs to be done. I went home feeling upset and shaken up, as an NHS nurse I'm completely disgusted. I couldn't have the mirena coil fitted at the end of the procedure as my BP was low, I felt nauseous, weak and the pain was so excruciating (and I've had a child this did not compare) that I had no trust in the surgeon that they wouldn't cause me further unmanageable pain. Something needs to change in this procedure as I and many women now feel traumatised, frightened for any future medical procedures and are left with a loss of trust in what should be a safe environment you can literally put your life in their hands.

title: Outstanding Rheumatology
body: I have been coming to this Rheumatology clinic for over 20 years. The staff, Nurses and Doctors are amazing. They are very friendly and totally professional in their Job. I was their in February and had a guided injection in my shoulder to drain the fluid off and had it injected. The Doctor who did it was really nice and had the perfect bedside manner. He explained everything he was doing. They are very thorough with your Rheumatoid. Its a pleasure to be a patient here.

title: Real old fashioned care
body:
Having several serious underlying health issues I need proper care and support especially at the present time. All the doctors plus the wonderful nurses offer and give full support. It reminds me how the doctors surgeries used to be like 30 years ago.

Unlike most surgeries, the doctor actually looks at my notes and medical history before my appointment so no wasted time asking silly questions. Yes there have been issues with prescriptions but these have been caused by the NHS computer systems etc not by the medical staff. I just also mention the staff always return phone calls as promised and speak slowly and clearly.

title: Excellent experience
body: I arrived early evening and was triaged, x-rayed and treated very quickly. I had fractured my ankle. All the staff I met were very professional and friendly. I would whole heartedly recommend this service.

title: Excellent practise
body: After arriving here after my Heart Attack and have a Stent put in after being diagnosed with CAD ..i was so grateful to all the staff throughout all the wards  i was so scared as only 47 and it was diagnosed as Heredirity so i was in total shock. Everyone was so helpful and friendly and professional and i cant thank you all enough.

title: Fantastic treatment
body: Thank you to all the staff in the diagnostic breast services, who all provided excellent, efficient and thoughtful care

title: wonderful care
body: I attended the urology outpatients on 14th March 2020 and I would like to compliment the entire staff for the care and professionalism I recieved.  Thanking you for making my visit so pleasant.

readBy.name: Wirral University Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: EXCELLENT SERVICE
body:
After being referred by my Optician, I had a pre-op at SpaMedica in Chapeltown, Sheffield. All went well on the Tuesday and was offered a slot for my cataract surgery on the Thursday. From start to finish the staff were brilliant and so efficient, I could not find fault with anything. If in the near future I have to have my other eye done I would have no hesitation in going to SpaMedica. Keep up the good work and many thanks.
Regards
Stewart McGowan

title: Efficient and good practice
body:
Husband needed a colonoscopy, only waited 2weeks for an appointment to the endoscopy initiative clinic on Sunday morning. Arrived just before 8, taken in by friendly, pleasant staff. Procedure carried out under entinox very efficiently by the Dr and nurse. He explained everything throughout and all was very professional, calm and turned an anxious procedure into a reassuring and positive appointment.
 Thank you very much. Mr and Mrs Simon Fowke 15/3/20

title: A positive experience
body: I am an older woman and I had a fall with resulting injuries. The staff could not have been more professional or caring. They were under extreme pressure at the time, but I felt well looked after and the attention was thorough in the extreme. I was with them for 5 hrs, but did not mind because they were very busy and couldn't have done more for me.

title: exellent practice
body: the staff from the driver who brought me and took me home to the reception staff and the nurses and surgeon are amazing I am so grateful that my optician recommended you.

title: Fantastic Team!
body: I phoned the practice at around 8.30am because my 12 year old son was in pain. We were seen at 9.45am. The staff were so professional, they treated him with dignity and put my son at ease. By 10.30am we were in the children's ward, thanks to the quick work of the practice. At 11.45am my son was in surgery. All went well. Thanks to all the staff at Carlisle healthcare - you are a fantastic team!

title: Good experience
body: In the past week, I have had occasion to visit A&E at Lincoln Hospital on two separate occasions. Both visits were entirely satisfactory and whilst I cannot say I did not wait a while for treatment, the initial triage was prompt, pleasant and efficient. Everyone who was involved in my treatment were caring and compassionate and responded to my questions and needs in a correct and professional manner. I would just like to to say a heartfelt ‘thank you’ to all involved and to wish the department all the very best in the coming weeks and maybe months during which time they will be tested to the full. Good luck to you all.

title: Excellent GP Practice
body: The GP's and ancillary staff, are professional, polite, and deliver an excellent service. Thank you.

title: Disorganised, no seats, long waiting time
body: Very poor experience at the NHS walk-in centre with my 2 year old. The receptionist was distracted by another nurse holding a baby and neglected to put the details in correctly. 1.5hours later having not seen triage I asked when we would be seen. She clearly knew she had made a mistake as told me that somehow the system had bipassed us for triage and would see a practitioner instead and that we were next to go through. 45mins later and 4 people later we go through. The doctor was blunt, my son,l (2 yrs) having waited over 2 hours was playing up a bit and no apology or accomodation was made for the mistake which would have reduced our time by well over 1/2 what we waited. Extremely poor.

title: Great practice
body: I would like to thank the to young ladys this morning that came to my house and put my mind at rest. X

title: Good practice
body: Thanks to all the staff for supporting our community especially at this worrying time. Think people forget you have families and same concerns as patients. Your services are very much appreciated.

title: wonderful care and support
body:
had to have a procedure in the urology department - consultant was re-assuring and the staff in the endo suite were friendly and helpful - would not hesitate to recommend this hospital - clean - quiet -
everything as it should be 

the service i received was 5  star

title: A relief!
body: Had to go to A and E about 9am on Thursday 12th March due to acute urinary retention following a prostate biopsy procedure at WGH 2 days previously.  In real pain. Seen by Triage Sister within 2 minutes, had a bladder scan 5 minutes later and a catheter fitted to relieve the pressure in another 5 minutes. So glad to be prioritised and seen so quickly. All staff very friendly and efficient. Knew their jobs and did them well.

title: Unpleasant A&E
body:
We visited A&E after a family member suffered a blow to the head. 

There were several waiting times screens and I didn’t know which applied to us so I asked reception. We were told they didn’t know and to speak to a nurse, which seemed like bad practice as the nurses looked very busy. They then, very ignorantly, averted their eyes back to the computer screen and wouldn’t communicate any further. 

We were put in one place by medical staff and then very rudely told to move by another, again, I just felt like an inconvenience despite only following staff instructions. 

With wait times between 30 mins - 7.5hrs and no one able to tell me which applied to us, we left after 3 hrs. 

Thankfully my family member is okay today and we aren’t local to Blackburn so should never have to visit A&E there again. It was an appalling experience. Many of the staff here could do with empathy training, I was disgusted and have never been treated this way at an NHS A&E before.

title: Thank you
body: My husband Got admitted to Accu on the 13th but unfortunately died on the 14th the staff were very kind and did not rush us in anyway through what was a devastating time. We stayed on the ward with my husband all day till 17pm giving family members travelling from far the chance to say goodbye and for this   I thank  you

title: Excellent Care
body: Attended Ward 3 for some pain management treatment.  All the staff were very friendly and extremely professional.  The level of cleanliness was outstanding; the ward was immaculate.  The whole process from admission, treatment through to discharge was extremely smooth and well organised. Everything was explained to me and I was put completely at ease by staff.  They were all very caring and compassionate.  I felt very well looked after.  The atmosphere in the department was calm and friendly.  Everyone seemed to work well together and show positive, strong teamwork for the wellbeing of their patients.  The procedure went well and I was discharged home with full information and completed paperwork.  I would like to say a huge 'thank you' to every member of staff for treating me so well.  They were all amazing.

readBy.name: Wrightington, Wigan and Leigh NHS Trust

title: Kind, efficient and hardworking
body: A close relative was admitted for surgery to repair a fracture and treatment of an emergency medical condition. I took him to A&E and visited him on the Surgical Short Stay Ward and I was so impressed with the care and efficiency of all the staff that I met during his treatment - in A&E, the X-ray porter, nursing staff on the ward and the physio. They are all so hardworking and treated us with kindness and respect throughout. Thank you all so much.

readBy.name: Royal United Hospital Bath NHS Trust

title: Excellent practice
body: This practice is one of the best in Coventry.  I have a chronic pain condition and regularly need to see my GP to be advised on how best to cope.  The staff are always courteous and I always get an appointment on the day.  Compared to many surgeries this one is the best in my opinion.  Well done all!

author: Foggydew
title: It has all worked well so I am very happy.
body:
Met with Lee audiology assistant at Taunton Audiology Department who helped me with new domes but also showed me how to use a tv streamer to aid my to appeal.  
It has all worked very well. So I am very happy.

readBy.name: Taunton and Somerset NHS Foundation Trust

author: djray10
title: They took the time to explain my condition.
body: Staff were fantastic at Monklands Hospital Diabetic Clinic. GP seen me in the evening and the next morning got a call to go to the David Matthews Centre. Staff were on hand they took time to explain my condition and call me every 2 days to see how my condition is and help me manage.

author: Ife
title: Depression cured.
body: I was down and totally lost hope of ever feeling better but thankfully got introduced to Inclusion Thurrock and now I’m so happy and hopeful.   I worked with a therapist who took time to evaluate my problems, gave me the right steps to get back to happiness within myself.     Thank you!

author: Gratefulpatient90
title: Great teamwork all round!
body: I would like to thank Leanne for her patience today when doing my gastroscopy, even after I couldn’t manage the first time. I would also like to thank Laura and May for helping keep me calm during my gastroscopy and also thank you Shona for the fast admission and Rhona for chatting to me on my arrival. Great teamwork all round! ! !

author: J's Mum
title: Cancer Diagnosis by letter
body:
My father has been diagnosed today with cancer and found out by letter . I’d like to know what is patient centred about this .  
He's been calling chasing biopsy results for 4 weeks to be told by a member of staff that his letter is in the post , and to please speak to his GP if he has questions, and then they promptly hung up on him. Of course he has questions, he has been told he has cancer.  
Is it policy to break bad news by letter? Without the human touch ? In my opinion this is a huge fail in your nhs core values .

title: great service during Corona virus
body: I rang the surgery as I had an eye infection and within 10 minutes the Dr had called me back and prescription sent to pharmacy.  fabulous service

title: Fantastic and caring practice
body:
We cannot state firmly enough the exceptional level of care we have always been offered by the Market Harborough Medical Centre.

Throughout our entire family, we are so confident and happy with the care that we receive, and believe that the Medical Centre has its patients best interests in mind at ALL TIMES.

Fantastic service.

title: Excellent treatment
body: On Friday evening (13th March) feeling ill went to west Cumberland A and E. After a short wait I was triaged and then examined by a Doctor. I spent the night in A and E observation ward for several test. I would just like to thank all the staff Who cared for me from the receptionist, Doctors’s, nurses, and the many support staff. All were professionally helpful, friendly and happy to explain my treatment or situation more than once. Thank you to all of you.

readBy.name: North Cumbria Integrated Care NHS Foundation Trust

author: HospitalNewbie
title: My unexpected first ever stay in hospital
body:
I went into A&E at 7:30pm Tuesday and watched (uncomfortably on those wooden seats) as Doctors and nurses worked relentlessly at trying to get through the completely full Emergency Department that seemed to never empty (the seat infront was broken hence being empty but every other one was filled). People had been there with emergency GP referrals which didn’t even fast track them as they sat alongside me as we went into the 10/12/15th hour of waiting... People literally left in tears because they were in so much pain and simply could not bear the wait any longer.  
10am Wednesday morning, my name was finally called... trust me, I didn’t know I had the patience either lol.  
Although my time lasted until the Friday evening after being admitted (I am okay now, but this isn’t the purpose of this post) which I totally was not expecting, I cannot commend the doctors and nurses enough! Because once you go through that door, the game changes... I said thank you to every one of these people at the time but thank you just didn’t seem a big enough way of showing my gratitude.  
- To the doctor that seen me in A&E that knew something was definitely wrong and called the surgeon to check me out too.  
- To the surgeon who also double checked me and recommended I stayed to get a procedure done or else I’d have to wait 2/3 months for it to happen.  
- To the nurse in CDU who realised that I had been awake all night (being 2pm now) and immediately found a bed for me to lie down and sleep. You have no idea how significant this was, THANK YOU!  
- To the nurse that came and hugged me and wiped away my tears when I totally freaked out going into theatre  
- To everyone in theatre who explained everything and calmed me down before starting.  
- To the doctor and nurses in Recovery who again reassured me and chatted to me even though they had 100 things going on around them and clearly under staffed  
- To the nursing student in 4 South that literally made me (and my fellow roomies) laugh and smile so much , you will make an excellent nurse!  
- To the two different nurses (one in A&E and one in 4 South) that took my blood. I hate needles and really don’t like it being done but these nurses were excellent, in and out before I could even pull a face! And didn’t tell me I should be used to it because I had a tattoo like other nurses do!  
- To my fellow roomies (in both wards) for chatting and making it a little less lonely in there and also taking the mick out of mine and their own illnesses, because if you didn’t laugh, you’d cry in the words of one of them.  
- To my amazing friends and family who came to visit, even those I didn’t expect, it meant so much!  
Some of these people won’t remember me because I was only one in million as they endeavoured to see everyone. But when you are in hospital you don’t have very much to do (after your phone dies) but to sit and watch and observe. These people are absolute heroes and I cannot thank them enough! Sitting in an A&E I was probably calling them all sorts but they really are remarkable!  
I can only imagine what that place is like because of recent events with Coronavirus. These doctors and nurses are heroes, remind them of this if you find yourself in there (I really hope you don’t though).  
Our doctors and nurses deserve more. I pray for more for them, for our health service, for our country, for this world.  
This wasn’t a post to gain sympathy for myself (for those concerned, I am on the mend now), or scrutinise our health service but to highlight how amazing our doctors and nurses are, even in the small things! 🌟

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great Practice
body: My family and I have been patients at this Surgery for 48 years and I can't recommend them enough. Caring, professional and friendly staff and doctors. Special thanks go to the Practice Manager who has been most helpful and caring. I can't praise the Surgery enough and hope all goes well at this very worrying time.

title: Caring professional practice
body:
I have recently developed a chronic condition.  I thus have had continuing care from the same general practitioner.  From the point of being called from the waiting room they exhibited a caring and welcoming attitude.  During the numerous consultations they exhibited empathy and their communication style was an exemplar of clarity whilst retaining the caring approach previously alluded too.  They go that extra mile despite the current pressures on practice.
Thank you.

title: Amazing staff
body: I went in all anxious and nervous and left feeling hopeful and cared for, even the assistant nurse was amazing, can't praise them enough

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Can't get an appointment for love nor money!
body: Spent 40 mins from 8.30 trying to phone for an appointment while only receiving the engaged tone. Traveled to work as I expected all the morning appointments to have gone and phoned again from work now 10.09. No appointments for today as not deemed urgent - phone back tomorrow at 8.30!!!!! I am in considerably pain with suspected carpal tunnel but won't bother again.

title: Excellent care, very considerate and caring…
body: I highly recommend this practice. The doctors are very caring and could not do enough for me following my recent diagnosis of cancer. Very considerate and have access to being seen on the same day. A truly wonderful family surgery

author: Karlb
title: Top work and a massive thank you.
body: I have recently been discharged from Otter Ward at RD&E, Wonford, Exeter. I can not praise the staff on this ward enough. Every member of staff were brilliant, from ward staff to the guys that bring the cups of tea and cleaning chap. So nice to see people actually enjoying their jobs and putting in that bit of extra effort to make a difficult situation more bearable. Cleaned and checked on a regular basis, which is really important, especially at present with the onset of Coronavirus looming. Top work and a massive thank you.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

author: Harryp
title: Dear Friend’s care
body:
A dear friend and long time work colleague was recently admitted to Ayr Hospital A&E department and from the minute she arrived until sadly she died her care could not have been better.  
The A&E Consultant went above and beyond as did all the nurses. She was transferred to CAU Orange zone and there her care continued. Doctors nurses etc could not have been bettered. All her friends and family are all of the same opinion. Please pass on our thanks to them all. We are always quick to criticise but usually slow to praise, but we are praising now. Thank you.

title: It's not that bad
body:
Yes some of the receptionists are a bit dry and don't smile all that often, however I have been witness to them dealing with abuse many times over not being able to offer appointments - something out of their control. I don't think I would be in such a great mood either if I had to deal with that day in day out. 

All nurses are lovely and Gps I have dealt with have been fantastic. 
Its a small practise and they will remember you when you return which is a nice touch. 
I just wish they could have a bit of a refurbishment as a lot of the practise feels dated.

author: Better at home
title: Good care at OPAT
body:
Following an out- patient surgical procedure I developed a known complication which was a septicaemia.  
The next day I developed confusion and felt very unwell. My wife drove me to the Accident and Emergency Dept. in FVRH where I was seen promptly and admitted to the Surgical Admissions Unit and then B31 where I had excellent medical and nursing care.  
I required 4 weeks I.V. Antibiotics but was able to be discharged after 5 days to attend the Outpatient Parenteral Antimicrobial Therapy Clinic(OPAT) from 04/02 to 01/03/2020. This service is a great development allowing me to go home instead of remaining in hospital which would have occurred in the past. I was also able for part of the time to self- administer the I.V antibiotic with the great support of the OPAT team -a new service they are developing. This saved me travelling and was very convenient.  
The OPAT team were always extremely helpful and very patient focused and did everything to make the procedure as comfortable as possible. Like the ward nurses they always had a smile on their faces which was welcomely therapeutic. I am now feeling much better and back to normal.  
Hopefully the service can be extended as not only does it save bed- days in hospital but is much more convenient for patients allowing them to recover in their own homes instead of having to remain in hospital. I am a retired Consultant Physician and would really have appreciated this service while I was still working.

author: ppl0
title: My dignity was maintained throughout
body:
I attended Victoria Hospital General Surgery dept in the morning as an out-patient to have haemorrhoids banded. I was admitted on time and everything was explained to me. The whole experience from being admitted, meeting the anaesthetist and the surgeon, being anaesthetised, I knew nothing of the op, being brought round, & in the recovery unit was all very good. I was kept informed every step of the way as to what was happening and I was dealt with the utmost respect and my dignity was maintained throughout. Discharged in the afternoon.  
Absolutely first class service I couldn’t have asked for more. Great work by all the staff involved.

readBy.name: Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: th20
title: A TURBT operation
body: Went into Lincoln hospital for a TURBT procedure on a Wednesday they took the catheter out on the Thursday. After about an hour I had a funny turn so they put the catheter back in for another 24hrs, on the Friday the doctor said to leave it in for another 24 hrs even though I was in pain, by the night time I was in agony and the nursing staff gave me morphine to cope. On the Saturday no doctor came to authorize the removal of it even though the nursing staff was phoning round all day to get one as they could see my extreme pain. It was removed on the Sunday. Now 10 days later I'm virtually house bound as cannot go far from a toilet due to being virtually incontinent. Now I am contacting my own doctor to see what can be done.

author: C90
title: Quality service
body: Quality service and care from GP. Dr Wilson at Conan Doyle Health Centre patiently explained infection and made sure I understood. Receptionist found me an appointment with a female doctor no bother. Thanks.

author: Hello4321
title: Contraception procedure
body: I attended the sexual health clinic to get contraception fitted. I was extremely nervous to the point I was crying beforehand. The care and reassurance I received from the nurse and the doctor was to an excellent standard and I cannot credit them enough. They made me feel so at ease whilst treating me with dignity and the best quality of care. They explained everything in a clear manner and they answered all of my questions to an excellent standard.

author: Miss-K
title: Care and compassion
body:
I have never received such care and compassion as I did at Amersham dermatology department when I needed to be hospitalised on numerous occasions for severe psoriatic arthritis. I owe my life to the HCA, nurses and doctors/consultants. Sister Helena ran a tight ship! As did Prof. Wilkinson, Drs Ratnavel, Sheru, George et al  
Thank You So Much

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Good Community Practice
body:
This practice is good, the reception staff and doctors do their best to support you. It is a busy practice but I am always seen, even if it’s two weeks away. The extra services they offer ie blood test, health check up, immunisation, makes life easy.  This saves additional travel time going elsewhere. 

I am glad I registered with this practice five years ago. With all the diverse range of people they serve in the community, we are lucky to have them. What would be good is the option to see a female doctor more often. I believe their is only one at this practice, which is disappointing. The male doctors are very understanding and caring. 
The doctors work extremely hard and have always been honest with their feedback. They genuinely care and understand the patients needs.  
 
The reception staff are attentive and do their best with scheduling appointments at short notice.  What would be good is scheduling appointments in advance for follow ups, ie medication review etc. It would be good if they could also offer weekend appointments, as I believe their would be a high demand for this service. Even if it was for the mornings only ie an oppourtuniy to carry out blood tests etc. 

I was disappointed when I so they had received a ‘ inadequate’ rating by CQC.

title: Never lets us down
body: My partner has mental health problems which pose many restrictions on communications and make getting even the simplest help complicated. Borough Road Surgery staff are AMAZING. They listen. They understand. They bend over backwards to help. I honestly think my partner would have been hospitalised on a number of occasions without their support.

author: AberdeenAngel
title: Feeling listened to meant the world
body:
I wanted to say thank you to the staff nurses in A&E who, have been absolutely incredible with me recently. My mental health has been really struggling and it has resulted in multiple trips to A&E because it’s got too much and ARI is where I feel safe. All of the staff nurses have been amazing but, notably I wanted to say a huge thank you to Isla. She has been there every single time, listened and let me feel heard and safe. She’s had a huge amount of patience with me and, it really hasn’t gone unnoticed.  
The A&E nurses are an absolute credit to NHS Grampian and I’m so grateful they’ve been there when my mental health has been desperately struggling.

author: TLW
title: The highest standard
body: After visiting the Dermatology Unit at RCHT Treliske I would like to say the care I received from Dr Bailey was excellent in every way and the operation she did on my ear was to the highest standard.

title: Amazing staff and service
body: My husband was quite poorly during Feburary and eventually collapsed at home in between GP appointments, at all times both the doctors and reception staff were kind , compassionate and extremely supportive and helpful, I cannot praise them enough.

author: Abdn81
title: Took very little history
body: I had an appointment today regarding ongoing situation with my hands. Very little history was taken and I do not feel that my concerns were listened to. I work in healthcare so my hands are really important as is washing them. Really wanted advice but I got a website instead.

author: lawro82
title: Newborn delivery
body: My daughter was born at Victoria Hospital in Kirkcaldy and I have nothing but praise for all the midwives and staff at the hospital who helped deliver our beautiful little girl Sofia. The service we received was brilliant and they made us feel so comfortable and reassured that we were in safe hands. Our birth plan was executed perfectly as they took special care to make sure we had it how we wanted.   We are over the moon being parents and we just want to let them know how much we appreciate their efforts and professionalism.

author: Harley biker
title: Solved my problem in minutes
body:
I telephoned audiology department at Musgrave Park Hospital Taunton as I had a problem with one of my hearing aids.  
I was given an appointment the following day.  
I was seen by a gentleman by the name of Lee who solved my problem in minutes by replacing parts in both of my hearing aids.  
Lee was very caring and efficient and a credit to the NHS.

readBy.name: Taunton and Somerset NHS Foundation Trust

title: Trying to get an appointment for my son
body: I have been trying to get an appointment after school for my son I have said it's not urgent but I do need one in next couple of weeks no way of booking an appointment in advance told for 3 days in advance now to ring back next day and still no appointments for after school. How is anyone getting these appointments if you cant book in advance.  Have been told if it's urgent then can have one at this rate i will be saying it is for an appointment even though I really dont want to

author: JoHoH
title: Hearing Aid repair
body:
I received my hearings aids in November 2018 and the one for my left ear has “buzzed” intermittently ever since. Two previous visits for repair appointments only solved the problem in the very short term with new tubing and trumpets and the buzzing came back. It was so loud people standing close to me could hear it.  
Last week I returned for a third visit and this time saw Lee and his manager Emma.  
It seems that because of my particular hearing loss an adjustment to the calibration (that was subsequently saved onscreen) was needed to resolve the problem and not the solutions offered previously.  
Very pleased to have had my first “buzz free” week and impressed with the care and attention given by Lee and Emma. Although disappointing that it took 3 visits to achieve this recalibration.

readBy.name: Taunton and Somerset NHS Foundation Trust

title: Friendly staff
body: Two teeth extracted recently, nurses and dental surgeon very kind and explained what the procedure entailed. Did not feel rushed, plenty of time allowed for questions.

title: Fantastic service
body: We took my son in with what we thought was a minor sprain but which turned out to be a broken wrist. We arrived at a busy waiting room at about 09:30 and were seen within half an hour. My son was quickly despatched off for an X-ray and then sent for the application of the cast. I saw three different members of staff, they were all friendly, kind, caring and obviously trying to be as quick and efficient as possible. I thought they did a fantastic job. Very impressed!

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

author: The good scott 5b
title: My hospital stay
body:
I was admitted with another flare up of my ulcerative colitis, during the time I was in ward 10 , the nurses and auxiliary staff were all fantastic .  
I was treated with respect , given and offered help 24/7 , during a time when the coronavirus was more and more prevalent these staff are in the firing line and they went about their job regardless and with a smile to top it off .  
I cannot thank them enough

title: Rude staff, never any appointments, poor patient…
body:
Receptionist staff very rude. No customer service skills whatsoever. Only recently become involved with this surgery and it is shocking. 

On calling the receptionist you are talked down to and spoken to as if you are stupid. On 3 occasions the wait to see the doctor was almost an hour with no apology whatsoever. The doctor then asks why you are there despite the fact you were asked to attend by the dr who has your notes in front of him! 

The practice nurse is shocking. Talked down to by her and spoken to like a child. Doesn’t even know the difference between certain conditions and was a long shot off doing her job properly. In future will be refusing treatment from her to see someone who actually knows what they are talking about. 

Terrible from start to finish and will be looking to move surgeries as soon as possible preferably where the staff treat you with respect and actually have knowledge of the conditions they are dealing with. 

A few courses in empathy, patient care and customer services would not go amiss here!

author: Tuli
title: Good treatment and information
body:
My dad has chest pains and came via ambulance to North Middlesex Hospital to get help. Though there was a few waits, Dr. Nwobodo helped him and us his family figure out what was going on.There is another doctor who helped after Dr Nwobodo’s shift ended. I will forever be grateful for them.  
Thank you!

title: Excellent care on Ward 21
body:
Our Mother was admitted to Ward 21 at the beginning of January  she was extremely unwell and spent a month on there in total.
All of the team : Medics ,Nurses, Therapists, HCAs and Housekeeping staff were outstanding in their roles .
 Everyone was professional, caring and kind to Mum and also supportive to us as a family . Thankyou Ward 21 and keep up the good work !

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Usually great
body: My experience with the pilgrim hospital over the years has always been a good one, they are always friendly and helpful in person, and you can tell the doctors and nurses work their absolute socks off! however I have a suggestion through the experience I've had with them recently which wasnt as great. We brought my son into a&e last weekend and found upon examination he had a dislocated elbow :( the paediatrician was wonderful and soon 'put him back together again' - we were happy and so was my son albeit very tired by this time, he was laughing again. A couple of days ago I was then called to say there would be a follow up appointment on monday (today), but she couldn't tell me the time from the system and just said it would tell me all i need to know in the letter that was being sent. Today - the day of the appointment I still have no letter. I have called the hospital and they have given me the time however it is far too short notice for me to make any work arrangements now . I tried to rearrange but again they could only give me a couple of days ahead and right in the middle of the day (1-3pm) . They couldn't do a morning, late afternoon or a weekend and unfortunately I cant just leave work at the drop of a hat as I dont work locally and my manager would need enough time to make other arrangements for someone else to cover my duties. I did query the question as to whether he needs the appointment or not as hes back to his usual self now anyway, or whether a more suitable appointment could be made at our gp surgery instead. They transferred me to the a&e department who then said they couldn't answer that for me and made me feel quite patronised - they said I would need to speak to orphadpedics (whom I was originally speaking to anyway and had transferred me!) They then had to put me back through to switchboard to pass me back to orphadpedics again. After being on hold for so long , I gave up and put the phone down. I assume they will just send me a new appointment in the post again? Hopefully I will receive this one in enough time but I may I suggest that your staff recognise that other people also work full time. I am left to feel guilty that I cant bring my  1 year old in for the appointment now even though we havent received the letter for it, i feel the people I spoke to over the phone weren't very understanding of my situation neither.

author: Slicker58
title: Great empathy with patients
body:
I have to give huge credit to Tom who is a Gynae oncologist, he is the most kindest caring professional I have came across.  
He has great empathy with his patients ...  
Friendly manor  
Nothing is an issue he will go above and beyond.  
I hope he gets recognition for his work as he thoroughly deserves it.

author: angel1882
title: A credit to their professions
body:
I would like to thank all the staff on the ward for the wonderful care my son and I received while we were in the ward. My son was born via emergency section after my induced labour did not go to plan. The care we received from when we arrived until we were discharged was exemplary and all of the team are a credit to their professions.  
I would also like to thank all of the surgical team for the care my son and I received and in particular the anaesthetist (whose name I wish I had been able to recall to thank him), who kept me calm both during my procedure when I was terrified and afterwards when I struggled in the recovery rooms. This man and the rest of the team are a credit to the maternity hospital.  
Thank you again

readBy.name: Office of Ken Macintosh, MSP for West of Scotland

author: CREELER
title: Hip replacement
body:
I underwent a hip replacement three weeks ago with the Copenhagen method being used.  
The whole experience has been amazing not least because of the exceptional care throughout in Ward 10 at Kirkcaldy. Nursing staff, cleaners, physios, occupational therapist and theatre staff were all first rate. Sadly i cant remember all the names.but Kirsten was a superb nurse and young Carly a breath of fresh air every time she was on the ward, thank you all.

title: thank you
body: thank you for all your help in this not easy time, you're doing great. I've got quick response, helpful advice of doctor on the phone and will do my blood test. Special thank you to reception, it was a pleasure to speak with them.

title: Very rude ladys
body: I am new to the areas and was told that this doctors surgery would be able to provide medicines for me.  I give my prescription in and a week later tried to pick up my drugs.  I was told that I could not have them but a doctor said I needed them.  A very rude lady who said she was in charge of drugs just argued with me and then told me that she had other things to do. Rude lady and still no drugs that a doctor said I needed.

author: HGAH
title: Staff ensured we were well informed throughout.
body:
Our son had dental surgery and was very apprehensive having experienced a late cancellation a few days previously at Inverclyde. The staff were first class led by consultant Gillian. All staff went out of their way to keep our son calm and communicate with us as parents throughout the day explaining in detail what was going to happen, ensure he was ready for surgery and ensure we were well informed throughout.  
The wider staff kept the children busy with activities on offer then they were entertained in the play room before surgery and this was fantastic and much appreciated as our son was relaxed and had great fun. Post procedure he was very well looked after and again we were advised how the surgery went and advice on discharge. We are very lucky to have our NHS and thanks to all the staff at the Royal Hospital for Children for their level of care.

author: B-2020
title: Multiple cancellations
body:
So in October I found I’ve got a 7 year running of infection both markers are slightly raised. So a referral to haematology was sent off in October of 2019.  
I got my first portal invitation for the 16th March. Great. I accepted. Just slightly before 2 weeks CANCELLED another appointment made for the April of 2020. Right ok I accepted it on the portal invitation but also spoke with the haematology secretary. All sorted, well that’s what I thought. ANOTHER appointment CANCELLED.  
how many appointments am I going to get offered for these many appointments to be cancelled for me to accept many appointments that are offered?  
It’s very stressful.

title: Worst Doctor I ever seen
body:
Since I am registered with this surgery I never meet my doctor!!!! When ever I called for appointment they always send me to a different doctor!!! And upon asking that where is my doctor they saying he is not available, he went already or it's his half day!!!!!  
Now on 17th May I went to asked for my doctor to attest my medical form but on reception I am been told that they will confirm with doctor and let me know. Today is 22nd May and there's no response!!! I called them several times and they are keep telling me that they will call me back but I never received a call from them??!!! 

I called the practice manager and she was not helpful either. I am so stress and upset they way they deal with me!!!!! I don't know what to do !!!

title: Recent experience
body: Rang for appointment about my foot which was really painful I was booked to see a nurse who referred me to a podiatrist Said I would have to wait this I did 6 weeks in pain to be told they could not help the information they were given was that  I had an ingrowing toenail, failed to mention to me she was going to say that I could have told she was wrong I have a pedicure monthly I was really upset at being in pain for so long with no resolution rang again for appointment no appointments available could only talk to doctor regardless of being in pain for weeks can’t even leave the practice I have privately been told the problem is more likely to be metatarsalgia and Mortons neuroma as I cannot get a proper diagnosis I have bought over the counter various foot supports which has helped and taken away the pain and inflammation in my toe.Today been trying to contact by phone their web site says 08.00 for receptionist it is now approaching 8.30 and still no answer. An appointment was made for Saturday but no-one turned up!!!! What is going on with this practice?????

author: Slicker
title: The care on the ward is amazing
body:
I had operation on Monday 9/3 and was in ITU  
For four days they were amazing couldn’t fault a thing the care given was 100%.  
Then I was worried being moved to the ward and was worried I wouldn’t get the same care  
However I was wrong the care here on the ward is amazing I had a regular pattern of staff which helped for continuity ....I want to say a huge thanks you to James ...Marcos and Juliet they were extra caring and went Above and beyond they need huge credit recognition for their care given...and as I am nurse I know how nice it is to be recognised for all the hard work provided.  
I would be very greatful if you could feed this positive feedback to the kind workers

readBy.name: Ashford and St Peter's Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: JMcD11
title: Mum’s hospital care
body:
My mum recently found herself in hospital with aspirate pneumonia. Initially she was very poorly but thanks to A&E & HDU staff she rallied round after spending over a week in hospital. She was stepped down to a General Medicine ward before being discharged home.  
Some thing you should know about my mum is that she is fully dependent on others to provide her care for her. This ranges from personal care, eating & drinking and mobilising.  
On packing her things prior to her discharge I noticed that the brand new tooth brush and tooth paste I had bought for her were still in the sealed packaging. I asked her if her teeth were brushed while she had been in hospital. She replied, no. While she was in HDU she was too unwell and I very much understood that as we (family & nurses) we’re giving her oral care with the pink sponges and cold water/ mouth wash. But since she was better not one person who had attended to her personal care needs had offered or asked if she wanted her teeth brushed.  
My mum gets her teeth brushed twice a day at home, like me and like most people who would’ve cared for her so I question why wasn’t her oral care attended to while in hospital? I know the importance of proper, good oral hygiene and how it can aid with positive patient outcomes. I am honestly appalled that this very basic need was not met when she was being washed and dressed or when getting ready for bed.

author: skybz39
title: Always treated with courteously
body: I was seen by Dr Gemmill in cardiology. All appointments leading up to seeing him were excellent, on time, and I have no complaints. The care was first class. I was always treated with courteously and given key information

title: Phone answering service very poor
body:
Strange that the frequency that I'm told I'm number eight in the queue happens.
Wait nineteen minutes or longer to get to number one in the queue and then after a further twenty minutes of being told to wait because all the lines are busy I might actually speak to a human or as has happened in the past be told that my call cannot be taken and cut off.
I'm still waiting to get a call back about a query as to whether I need a prescription for something from the pharmacy.

title: Ridiculous procedure to book an appointment
body:
The hoops you have to jump through to even be able to speak to a doctor or book an appointment are becoming ridiculous. For at least 5 or 6 yearsyou can't just phone to book an appointment for the day and doctor of your choice. Then you had to get an app to book a phone consultation with a doctor to *see* if you need an appointment.

Now the old app doesn't work and you are forced to use Doctorlink, which is even more useless. Now you gave to fill in a pointless, tone wasting questionnaire to even be able to get a doctor to call you back. With no indication when they will. Truly appalling. How is this saving time or money? It's a joke.

title: Dont join this sergury you can not get an…
body:
I have been at this practis for over 10 years and the Orchard sergury in Langley has been consisinitly useless. 
To hide the fact that there is around a months waiting list to see a Dr now, they only let you book in the morning at 8 am by phone on that day. 
Today the same as any orher day I had to phone 77 x  from 8am till 8:15 am untill I even got a dile tone. 
I then spent 5 mins ion hold till someone became available to take my call, only to be told all the bookable slots had gone for the day, so to try again tomorrow. 
So you guys understand what I am saying, you are unable to even make an appointment full stop, not for tomorrow ,next week or a months time, simply you can not do it. This has to be the worse system ever. 
Any of the reviews that give this place more than 1 star, I would highly dought we raised by patients. 
Avoid it like the plague. 
You have been warned.

title: unhelpfull
body: I rang the practice for a fit note for my son who had recently be discharged from a rehabilitation center. I was 3rd in the queue and still waited 42 minutes for someone to answer. when they did they said they are not dealing with fit notes at the moment due to coronavirus. I told them I needed one for a new benefit claim, she said we cant help at present. call taker abrupt and unwilling to help.

title: Great care
body:
On 20th February 2020 I fell and badly broke my ankle and I want to thank everyone who helped me. The ambulance people, A&E and Ward 27.

I especially want to thank the team that operated on my ankle on 21st February 2020.

I had an epidural and sedation so I was awake for some of the time 
and I feel privileged to have experienced the amazing care, hard work and dedication the team demonstrated.  I thank them all so much and hope my comments are passed on to each of them.

title: the doctor
body: Im abaustly fuming with the doc and staff at this surgery I have been askjng for 2 weeks for tablets and none of them have been done im back anf forth to rhe chemist and doc cause nothing gets done propley with out making a fuss I have a broken ankle and had to wakk down the doc 4 times to get some tablets but no tablets were givin asked the doc to ring me several times to talk bout tablets and my pain n previous operation not had a call back yet rhdte not good woth mental health either duno why I bothered joining these there so rude im fuming wit hkw they tfeat there staff thats In pain

title: Catalogue of Errors
body:
- dr completely missed a diagnosis of diabetes and I ended up very poorly and in hospital some months later
- months on still no referral to diabetic specialists 
- medication not reviewed on time so run out 
- drs are CONSTANTLY calling in sick leaving the surgery with no doctors in at all, and the locums are often rude and don’t care 
- the admin/reception staff refuse to chase up hospital discharge records but the hospital refuse to talk to the patient so you’re left frustrated and stuck in the middle of a pathetic battle of stubbornness 
- I’ve had blood tests every 6 weeks that show something wrong with my white blood cell count but rather than find out what the problem is (potentially leukaemia!!), each new locum dr keeps sending me away again for another 6 weeks 

I’m trying to find another GP practice in the area with at least some good reviews - it’s impossible!! DONT MOVE TO LUNDWOOD!!

title: Rude reception staff
body:
I called to enquire how to book an appointment for my staff member who felt dizzy and faintish at work and because it is always a very long time to stay on the phone I decided I will do this for her. I explained the history and said that due to her previous issues maybe a blood test would be good, the receptionist who's name I will disclose to the practice manager asked me straight away whether I was a doctor myself making me feel really intimidated. I explained that I can only describe symptoms which look like anaemia to me having experienced this myself and the fact that she has had previous issues, she commented "Oh dear" in a very sarcastic way.
I was shocked that someone who suppose to be concerned for the patients and suppose to have people skills to speak with the public would just throw such inappropriate comments. This receptionist comes across as if she hates her job and people she needs to deal with. I would be happy to discuss this further with the person in charge of the surgery as I find such behaviour unacceptable.

title: Incompetence at its best
body:
In all the years I have been registered at with this surgery I have never been able to get an appointment except by ringing at 08:00 am on the day and if you get through you beg and plead for one. 

This means that those of us who work have to take the time off work to try and secure an appointment as we aren't sure when or if this will occur. But to add insult to injury even though their website stipulates that they will now see you in person at the surgery at 08:00 am as well as taking your phone call, if you make the mistake of making the effort to turn up at the surgery because you can get no one on the phones they tell you to take a ticket and join a long line whilst they go on prioritising those on the phone which invariably means that when they get to you all the appointments for that day have been taken. 

The receptionist believe they have you captive so they can speak to you without respect and when you question their policy simply gesticulate for you to go and take a ticket and basically waste your entire day. Do these people realise that people have to work to pay taxes which pays their salaries and that the working public should be treated with a little more regard than a bark?

title: Vaccination issues
body:
I decided to postpone vaccination for my child and do it little later, the GP doctor said it’s ok and this is my personal choice as a mother.
I came back with my child when he was ready for vaccinations, and asked to do one shot first and the next week 2 remaining shots. The nurse and manager didn’t allow me to to that, saying that they will do either all shots in one go or nothing. When I said that I need to think about that, they said that they will not give me more appointments and remove my child from patient list. Also manager of the clinic said that they will not take any recponcibolity if child will have any side effects after vaccination, and only mother is responsible for child’s vaccination. If so why not letting mother to split vaccines?! Basically we were refused to do a vaccination and left with no GP practice. How ridiculous is that?! To me it looks that these guys bother about stats and how they look in the system but not on peoples’ health. And I am paying taxes and supporting the NHS system while my child can’t get vaccination when he needs one!

author: HFgirl
title: I always felt safe, even when the worst happened.
body:
I was admitted to IRH at the end of last year for an emergency appendectomy. Mr Hannay did my surgery and his whole team were amazing. I have a heart condition which meant I was not put on a ward but in HDU where I could be monitored closely. I stayed on HDU for a few more days until I took very unwell and was moved to ICU and put on a ventilator. My family were told they may lose me.  
But I survived, I was transferred to Golden Jubilee as with all the infection etc I now had heart failure. I wanted to thank the whole HDU staff and ICU especially Mr Hannay, Dr Staber, Dr Husain my cardiologist and Sarah-Anne my device nurse and every single nurse that looked after me. I always felt safe, even when the worst happened and I really was scared with my breathing, they were there holding my hand and getting me through it. I'll never be able to repay the staff for saving my life.  
I also want to thank all the nurses on behalf of my family, I had a busy relatives room the night I was put on ventilator and everyone was patient and understanding with them all. Thank you all for everything. I'm sorry I cannot name you all but special shout out to Kelly-Anne, Anne, Nicola and Nicola. Thank you for going above and beyond with me. I still have care at IRH with Sheila, my heart failure nurse, and attend a clinic at Jubilee too. I was very well looked after.

readBy.name: Office of Ken Macintosh, MSP for West of Scotland

author: JJJJ
title: Professional and compassionate care
body: My Nan took unwell and was taken to City Hospital. I wanted to thank all the staff for the level of service they were able to provide and I observed with others, specifically during the extra stress placed upon the organisation during COVID 19. There was a quick efficient procedure of care for all patients immediately from   the entrance keeping all safe. I was given updates as requested during a distressing time for myself which was greatly appreciated. From the 999 call to going home I am greatly thankful for the professional and compassionate care she received and whilst there is a lot of criticism placed upon the NHS at this time I felt you needed to be aware of this experience.

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Horrendous Waiting Times in the Surgery
body:
Since the surgery moved over into the new building, the service is awful. You are never seen on time and when the doctors come out to call you, if you aren't sat near their room you can miss them. No screens to advise that you are being called.
Our 9 week old baby has been kept over an hour today, and still not seen yet, previous appointments have all run late. 
If you are thinking of joining don't there has to better out there!!!!!

title: Ok, seems to be improving under new management
body: I visit the practice fairly regularly. The doctors have almost always been excellent, and reception staff are usually helpful. Appointment availability has improved I think. So overall I am satisfied. However the practice is a little shabby with far too many hard-to-read posters cluttering the walls. I have sometimes had trouble knowing when I have been called in - e.g. name appears on a screen I can't see, doctor shouts from far away and I can't hear clearly, or once I gave my DOB etc and they told me to take a seat but never marked me as arrived so I waited an hour! Recently the phlebotomist had no idea why I was there and asked me what kind of blood test I wanted, initially getting it wrong.  Little things like this make a big difference to making patients feel valued and welcome. I would say the actual medical service is very good, but the experience at the practice not always so good.

author: Breath
title: Made me feel at ease with their witty humour
body: I received two minor operations today at Forth Valley Royal. The staff David, Jen and Laurionn were excellent, they chatted throughout making me feel at ease with their witty humour. Thank you and keep up the great work

author: filingsb36
title: Welcoming and reassuring
body: I want to commend the reception staff in A&E and staff nurse Andrea. She was very welcoming and reassuring. I was very lukcy when I turned up as A& E was quiet and I was seen in 4 minutes.

author: Betty Bond
title: Very happy with my treatment
body: I felt very apprehensive beforehand. But have to say the Nursing Staff were very understanding and reassuring. I was very happy with my treatment and would have no problems if I had to undergo this again. So full marks to the team at Victoria. 👍🏻

author: PregnantinCumbernauld
title: Community midwife in Cumbernauld
body:
I submitted this previously but I'm not sure it went through. So trying again. It's also given me a little opportunity to add to it and reflect even more.  
I am now 29 weeks pregnant, but I found out around 2-3 weeks. Being my first pregnancy, at the age of 33, you might expect I had a good idea from idea from others what pregnancy entailed but I did not. I didn't even quite know how to feel about it all. One of the first things I became nervous of was meeting my midwife for my first appointment. Would I like them? Would they listen to me? Would they be judgemental? Would I feel part of the process or would I feel that the process was being done 'to' me, as opposed to 'with' me? Will they explain things?  
I needn't have worried.  
I met with Samantha for my first appointment and was immediately put at ease. I had a number of worries and concerns, both medical and personal, and she listened with interest, compassion and empathy. Her supportive personality and manner immediately put me at ease, and I left feeling extremely grateful she would be with me through this journey. Unfortunately for me (but fortunately for all those who had chosen Wishaw for their birth) Samantha has moved on to the Best Start programme and while I wish her all the very best, I will miss her dearly.  
I didn't realise what I needed from a midwife in those earlier stages, but it turns out that it is everything that is Sam: organised, caring, professional but personable, a good listener, good at explaining everything (ensuring proper informed consent all the way through), strong attention to detail, and attentive. Despite the pressures of the NHS, I was never made to feel like another 'client'/'case'. She spoke with confidence and passion about her work and about her care for the women in her case load, and while I struggled in the earlier stages, all of this was made better and easier each and every time I saw Sam. A good example of this is when it became clear I was suffering from hyperemisis gravidarum (HG). Having had a negative interaction with a GP who was incorrectly citing research regarding the risks of anti-sickness medication, Sam immediately sought me the help I would need. As I left my appointment, I was greeted by another GP at Kennilworth, Dr MacPherson, who immediately and without question prescribed me what I needed (and what continues to help me now). As a university lecturer, with a PhD and who conducts research, it was clear that Sam had also done her research and was up to date on the issues surrounding HG and this was very reassuring in terms of care. Furthermore, in discussions regarding breast feeding she was neither pushy nor judgemental, something I highlighted I would not have appreciated anyway. I often went in armed with lots of research and information, just in case, but with Sam, I never needed to refer to anything like that. She already knew it all.  
Filled with trepidation now at meeting whoever will have taken on my case, I can only hope that Sam is reflective of the wider midwifery service in Cumbernauld.  
*Update: While there appeared to be some issues with the transfer of Sam's caseload, and I appeared for an appointment in my maternity app that no one else seems to have noticed, Sam - even though she had technically left the service - still sorted this out for me. I am extremely grateful and appreciative. A complete credit to the profession!  
I hope this can be passed to those at the Cumbernauld/North Lanarkshire service. In times of increasing job precarity, lack of resources and funding, staffing issues etc, I believe it is important to continue to highlight the wonderful service that some/many of our NHS workers provide despite the challenging environment.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership
